Scale the 2D sketch by 0.6678. 6. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. 7. Extrude the 2D sketch by 0.0146 towards the normal and 0.0 opposite the normal to create a 3D model with a height of 0.0146, length of 0.6678, and width of 0.6678. **Part 2: Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a slightly tapered top and bottom.** 1. Within the sketch, create a new face (face\\_1). 4. On face\\_1, create a loop (loop\\_1) that consists of the following lines: - line\\_1: [0.0, 0.0] to [0.0877, 0.0] - line\\_2: [0.0877, 0.0] to [0.0877, 0.117] - line\\_3: [0.0877, 0.117] to [0.0, 0.117] - line\\_4: [0.0, 0.117] to [0.0, 0.0] 5. Extrude the 2D sketch by 0.1072 towards the normal and 0.0 opposite the normal to create a 3D model with a height of 0.1072, length of 0.117, and width of 0.117. These steps will construct a 3D model consisting of two rectangular prisms, one with a flat top and bottom, and the other with a tapered top and bottom. The dimensions of the parts and final model match the provided JSON data.</description>
